underlying_goal: To understand why some Claude skills consume many tokens and to optimize them to reduce context usage.
friction_detail: Claude initially believed the full skill files were loaded at startup, but then corrected this understanding based on official docs (only name/description are loaded at start, full file on activation). It still proceeded with the refactoring as it was a recommended best practice.
primary_success: Correctly identifying that large, embedded templates within skill files were the cause of high token counts and systematically refactoring them into reference files to be loaded on-demand, following the progressive disclosure pattern.
brief_summary: The user asked why some skills had high token counts. Claude investigated and found that large templates were embedded directly in the skill files. After a brief misunderstanding and self-correction about token loading, Claude proceeded to refactor five skills/commands, moving bulky content into reference files to be loaded on-demand, dramatically reducing their static complexity.
